title: US judge dismisses lawsuit against Saudi crown prince over Khashoggi murder
description: A federal judge has dismissed a lawsuit against Saudi Arabia's crown prince after the Biden administration recommended he be granted immunity in the case brought against him by the fiancée of murdered Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi.

title: The very last 747 jumbo jet is about to roll off Boeing's assembly line
description: After 53 years and more than 1,570 planes, the last Boeing 747 is set to roll off the assembly line in Washington state Tuesday, on its way to serve as a cargo plane.

title: Why Trump wasn't charged in Trump Organization's felony scheme
description: A Manhattan jury has found two Trump Organization entities guilty on all counts in connection to a 15-year tax fraud scheme. CNN correspondent Kara Scannell reports.

title: Ronaldo watches from bench as replacement scores hat-trick in Portugal win
description: No Cristiano Ronaldo, no problem for Portugal as it produced a dynamic display to thrash Switzerland 6-1 and reach the quarterfinals at Qatar 2022.

title: Trump Organization found guilty on multiple counts of criminal tax fraud
Extraordinary discovery of gold and gem necklace reveals powerful role for women 1,300 years ago
description: Archaeologists have discovered a stunning 1,300-year-old necklace, made of gold, garnets and other semiprecious stones, at an excavation site in central England earmarked for a housing development.

title: Family of fallen Capitol Police officer refuses to shake hands with GOP leaders
description: The family of fallen US Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick snubbed Republican leaders Sen. Mitch McConnell and Rep. Kevin McCarthy at a ceremony held to honor law enforcement who defended the US Capitol during the January 6, 2021, insurrection. CNN's Jessica Dean has more.

title: Watch one-year-old's remarkable reaction after being accidentally locked in car
description: One-year-old Z'Naria Lukie was accidentally locked in a car. See how she cleverly followed her mother's instructions to make a safe escape.

title: McConnell criticizes Trump's comments on the Constitution
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell criticized former President Donald Trump's comments in a post on Truth Social earlier this week that called for the "termination" of the Constitution.

title: Ronaldo benched against Switzerland
description:
• Morocco stuns Spain in penalty shootout to reach first ever quarterfinals
• World Cup quarterfinals: Who has qualified and what to expect

title: DOJ subpoenas officials in Wisconsin and Michigan for communications with Trump around 2020 election
description: Special counsel Jack Smith has subpoenaed local officials in Wisconsin and Michigan for any and all communications with then-President Donald Trump, his 2020 campaign and a number of aides and allies, multiple sources confirmed to CNN.

title: Morocco stuns Spain in penalty shootout to reach first ever quarterfinals
Pelé's health is gradually improving after hospitalization, doctors say
description: Brazil soccer great Pelé's general health is gradually improving after he was hospitalized last week in Sao Paulo after contracting a lung infection, according to a statement from the hospital treating him.

title: Georgia Senate runoff: Federal election monitors sent to several counties
The year in pictures
Georgia Senate runoff: Federal election monitors sent to several counties
Rare guitar given as a gift by Marie Antoinette expected to sell for $84,000
description: Marie Antoinette may be better remembered for her tragic demise than as a musician, but a guitar thought to have belonged to the ill-fated monarch is expected to sell for up to €80,000 ($84,000) when it's auctioned later this week.

title: Top Trump adviser Stephen Miller returns to testify before January 6 federal grand jury
description: Former Donald Trump adviser Stephen Miller on Tuesday returned for another day of testimony before the federal grand jury investigating January 6, 2021, and efforts to subvert the 2020 election.

title: House January 6 committee has decided to make criminal referrals, chairman says
description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol has decided to make criminal referrals to the Department of Justice, the panel's chairman, Rep. Bennie Thompson, told reporters Tuesday.

title: Analyst breaks down how much weight Jan. 6 criminal referrals hold
description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol has decided to make criminal referrals to the Department of Justice, the panel's chairman, Rep. Bennie Thompson (D-MS), told reporters. CNN legal analyst Elliott Williams explains.

title: House January 6 committee has decided to make criminal referrals, chairman says
description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol has decided to make criminal referrals to the Department of Justice, the panel's chairman, Rep. Bennie Thompson, told reporters Tuesday.

title: Watch guest conductor dance his way to internet fame
description: Conductor gone wild. Watch guy who won a raffle get to conduct an orchestra. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Crowd gathers in New York City to bring an art installation to life and demand 'all eyes on Iran'
description: Chants of "Woman, Life, Freedom" echoed Sunday around Roosevelt Island in New York City as hundreds gathered to bring to life an art installation symbolizing solidarity with the women leading the uprising in Iran.

title: What we know about the strikes on air bases inside Russia
description: A series of attacks deep inside Russia this week have raised the stakes for Moscow at a time when its war on Ukraine is faltering.

title: Morocco and Spain goalless at half-time
Colorado Springs suspect formally charged with 305 counts in Club Q shooting
description: The suspected gunman accused of killing five people in a mass shooting at an LGBTQ nightclub in Colorado Springs, Colorado, last month has been formally charged with 305 counts, including murder, attempted murder, assault and bias-motivated crimes.

title: Ashton Kutcher and twin Michael talk health, guilt and rift between them
description: In a rare interview, twin brothers Ashton and Michael Kutcher talked about both their bond and their rift.

title: World Cup quarterfinals: Qualifying teams, fixtures and schedule
description: We are waiting on two teams to qualify for the World Cup quarterfinals, but six have already booked their places in the last eight. Who are they and how did they get there?

title: Oxford Dictionary's 2022 word of the year is ...
description: Oxford Dictionary has announced "goblin mode" as its choice for 2022's Word of the Year after it opened voting to the public. The term is used to describe a type of behavior that is unapologetically lazy and self-indulgent. CNN senior data reporter Harry Enten explains.

title: Philadelphia is launching a plant-based cream cheese
description: Philadelphia Cream Cheese is launching a non-dairy version of its signature spread.

title: McDonald's franchisee violated child labor laws, investigation finds
description: A McDonald's franchise operator has violated child labor laws, according to an investigation by the Department of Labor.

title: Spain takes on Morocco in today's World Cup knockouts
description:
• Goals and dance moves: Brazil dazzles against South Korea to reach quarterfinals
• World Cup quarterfinals: Who has qualified and what to expect

title: 'Not how you treat friends.' Biden's climate plan strains trade ties with Europe
description: The world's biggest economic relationship has hit a rough patch.

title: Former Trump official says he may launch 2024 bid to stop Trump
description: John Bolton, who served as former president Donald Trump's national security adviser, says he is contemplating entering the 2024 presidential race to stop Trump from getting a second term in office.

title: Analysis: Blasts deep inside Russia hand Putin a fresh problem
description: Moscow's accusation that Ukrainian drones struck two airbases deep inside Russia has once again raised the febrile question of escalation nine months into the war.

title: John Travolta and Kirstie Alley: A love story
description: Kirstie Alley and John Travolta were never romantically involved, but that wasn't how she initially wanted it.

title: Bella Hadid's Model of the Year win and more highlights from the Fashion Awards
description: "London is back," announced Selling Sunset's Christine Quinn, whose pre-recorded year-in review-video message opened the 2022 Fashion Awards on Monday evening. "New York is back, Paris is back, Milan is back," Quinn continued, as viral runway moments from fashion houses including Bottega Veneta, Coperni, Tommy Hilfiger flashed across screens inside the historic Royal Albert Hall in London.

title: Neil Diamond surprises theatergoers with performance of 'Sweet Caroline'
description: Neil Diamond surprised theatergoers with a performance of his hit "Sweet Caroline" during the opening night of a new Broadway musical based on his life and career. The impromptu performance is a rare appearance for the 81-year-old music icon who announced his retirement from touring in early 2018 because of his Parkinson's disease diagnosis.

title: Airlines will be making money again in 2023 as travel recovers
description: The global airline industry is expected to return to profitability in 2023 for the first time in four years.

title: Robin Meade signs off after HLN's last broadcast
description: After a 40-year run, HLN's live news programming has come to an end. HLN's anchor Robin Meade gives her final sign off in the last live broadcast of her show, Morning Express.

title: 'Unheard of': Ret. US Army Major reacts to drone strike in Russian airfield
description: An airfield in Russia's Kursk region that borders Ukraine was hit with a drone strike. Ret. US Army Major Mike Lyons explains how the attack, which Ukraine has not taken responsibility for, is an advantage for Ukraine.

title: Shein tells suppliers to end long working days at factories by end of the month
description: Chinese fast fashion retailer Shein, the subject of recent controversy around alleged labor rights abuses, says it plans to invest $15 million to improve working conditions at factories in its supply chain.

title: The world will gain enough renewable energy in 5 years to power China, says IEA
description: Global renewable power capacity is set to grow as much in the next five years as it has over the past two decades, as soaring energy prices and the climate crisis force governments to ditch fossil fuels.

title: 6 everyday ways to keep back pain at bay
description: For many people, back pain can make it difficult to function in everyday life. It affects how you move, feel and think, leaving you with no choice but to take some kind of action to alleviate the pain.

title: Russia deploys defense missile system on Kuril island near Japan
description: Russia's defense ministry said Monday it has deployed mobile coastal defense missile systems on a northern Kuril island, part of a strategically located chain of islands that stretch between Japan and the Russian Kamchatka Peninsula.

title: Scientists finally know why people get more colds and flu in winter
description: A chill is in the air, and you all know what that means — it's time for cold and flu season, when it seems everyone you know is suddenly sneezing, sniffling or worse. It's almost as if those pesky cold and flu germs whirl in with the first blast of winter weather.

title: This is the perfect holiday gift for mom
description: After two years in which many dialed back celebrations during the Covid-19 pandemic, this holiday season likely will be supersized. Many of us are making up for those missed opportunities with more celebrations with more people.

title: K-pop band Blackpink selected as Time Entertainer of the Year 2022
description: Global pop sensation Blackpink have been chosen as Time magazine's 2022 Entertainer of the Year, making the four-woman band the second K-pop artists to earn the title, after BTS in 2020.

title: Facebook Oversight Board recommends overhaul of controversial content moderation process for VIPs
description: After a yearlong review, Meta's Oversight Board on Tuesday said the company's controversial system that applies a different content moderation process for posts from VIPs is set up to "satisfy business concerns" and risks doing harm to everyday users.

title: Second Oath Keepers sedition trial presents new challenges for prosecutors
description: One week after the historic seditious conspiracy conviction of Oath Keepers founder Stewart Rhodes, federal prosecutors will try to once again prove that other members of the far-right militia were planning to violently stop Congress from certifying the 2020 presidential election.

title: 5 things to watch as Georgia decides Warnock vs. Walker Senate runoff
description: The final drama of the 2022 midterm elections is coming to a head in Georgia on Tuesday, as Peach State voters -- for the second time in as many years -- cast ballots in a high-stakes US Senate runoff.

title: How a former tech worker fighting against workplace discrimination emerged as an advocate for whistleblowers
description: Ifeoma Ozoma's path as an advocate for tech workers started with a series of tweets one morning in June 2020.

title: Tom Brady makes record 44th fourth-quarter comeback as the Tampa Bay Buccaneers beat the New Orleans Saints
description: When his team trails in the fourth quarter, Tom Brady is almost inevitable.

title: Al Jazeera to submit Shireen Abu Akleh case to ICC, network says
description: Al Jazeera said Tuesday it will submit a case to the International Criminal Court (ICC) over the killing of journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, who was shot in the head while covering an Israeli raid in Jenin in the occupied West Bank in May.

title: A hallelujah moment for iPhone users everywhere
description: Back in 2018 — that is to say, five iPhone generations ago — an acquaintance shared a picture of a bunch of frayed and useless Apple Lightning charging cables on my Twitter feed, complaining that as a trillion-dollar company, Apple should "figure out a way to make better cords."

title: What it's really like to live in Monaco
description: Described as a "sunny place for shady people," by English novelist W. Somerset Maugham, Monaco is one of the smallest and wealthiest countries in the world.

title: Two former Seoul police officers arrested over deadly Halloween crush
description: Two former police officers were arrested in South Korea on Monday, accused of destroying evidence relating to the deadly Halloween crowd crush in Seoul, according to authorities in the country.

title: Why Democrats want a 51-49 majority
description: If Democrats win the Senate runoff in Georgia and secure a slim 51-49 majority over Republicans, they will have significant governing advantages compared to the 50-50 split in the current Congress, during which a power sharing agreement gives Republicans considerable leverage over Democrats despite being in the minority.

title: How Bush v. Gore led to the new monumental challenge to presidential election rules
description: When Chief Justice William Rehnquist helped decide the 2000 presidential election, his radical legal theory failed to gain a majority. But today's conservative court is giving it another chance, in a case that could transform elections in 2024 and beyond.

title: China's Xi calls for unity at former leader Jiang Zemin's memorial service
description: China's Xi Jinping on Tuesday called on the country to unite around his leadership as he addressed a memorial service for former leader Jiang Zemin, following an unprecedented show of dissent over his zero-Covid policy and authoritarian rule.

title: Opinion: In all Ukrainian kitchens, a secret weapon against Putin
description: After long days working in offices dotting Kyiv's downtown, a small group of women head to their kitchens. Their evening job is just beginning.

title: Hawaii activates National Guard as lava from Mauna Loa slowly inches closer to critical highway
description: Officials in Hawaii have activated the state's National Guard to help in the response to the eruption of Mauna Loa, whose lava has been steadily oozing toward a critical highway for days.

title: Italy reckons with over 1,400 sites linked to fascist past
description: A group of Italian historians has published an online directory of sites associated with the country's fascist past. This comes just a month after the formation of Italy's latest government, the most far-right in its post-war history.  CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: Family of boy thrown from Mall of America balcony reaches settlement with mall
description: More than three years after a boy was thrown over a balcony at the Mall of America in Minnesota, the child's family has reached a settlement with the mall, the family's attorneys said.

title: The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Russia says there will be no withdrawal from Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
Reporter describes 'rare' behavior from Xi at former leader's memorial
description: At the Great Hall of the People in central Beijing, Chinese leader Xi Jinping led thousands of China's Communist Party, state and military elites to pay final tribute to former leader Jiang Zemin, who died at the age of 96. Previously, Xi and former president Hu Jintao, are seen paying respects to Jiang and his family at a Beijing hospital . CNN's Steven Jiang has more.

title: Santa Claus, the KKK, and other bizarre hypotheticals raised by Supreme Court in LGBTQ rights case
description: While hearing a case about whether a graphic designer can refuse to serve gay couples, the Supreme Court debated whether a shopping mall Santa Claus could decline to take a photo with a child dressed a KKK costume.

title: Taiwan's 'living hell' traffic is a tourism problem, say critics
description: It's been nearly two months since Taiwan lifted its entry restrictions and ended mandatory quarantine, allowing most international tourists to visit the island.

title: Kirstie Alley, 'Cheers' and 'Veronica's Closet' star, dead at 71
description: Actress Kirstie Alley, star of the big and small screens known for her Emmy-winning role on "Cheers" and films like "Look Who's Talking," has died after a brief battle with cancer, her children True and Lillie Parker announced on her social media.

title: Man involved in shooting of Lady Gaga's dog walker sentenced to 21 years in prison
description: One of the people charged in the shooting and robbery of Lady Gaga's dog walker last year has been sentenced to 21 years in state prison, the Los Angeles County District Attorney's office said Monday.

title: 'I was taking 55 Vicodin a day': Matthew Perry explains why he can't re-watch 'Friends'
description: Matthew Perry shared his struggle with drug and alcohol addiction while filming the hit TV show 'Friends,' and explains why he hasn't re-watched the series.

title: Hear how Pence reacted to Trump's call to terminate Constitution
description: Anderson Cooper looks at how former and current GOP lawmakers reacted to former President Donald Trump's statement on terminating the Constitution in this "Keeping Them Honest."

title: Video shows explosion at air base in Russia
description: Explosions at two Russian air bases have focused attention on Ukraine's efforts to develop longer-range combat drones. Retired Lt. Gen. Ben Hodges explains why this development could be significant in the war with Russia.

title: Documentary chronicles an unexpected side of prison life
description: "Apokaluptein: 16389067" is what artist Jesse Krimes dubbed his prison contraband — a project so off-limits, he had to create it behind bars in secret and smuggle it out.

title: Japan wins plaudits for World Cup shocks and fans cleaning up in stadiums
description: Japan bids the World Cup farewell after its World Cup last-16 penalty shootout defeat by Croatia on Monday, but the team and its fans left lasting memories that won the Asian nation plenty of plaudits in Qatar and across the watching world.

title: Attacks on Russian air bases put spotlight on new Ukrainian drone program
description: Explosions at two Russian air bases Monday have focused attention on Ukraine's efforts to develop longer-range combat drones.
